name: Mountain Clammer
description:
Traverse up a deep undersea mountain as a tiny climb as you try to get back to your boat. Swing yourself up past the top of frame to reach the next level. "Escape" opens up a menu you can quit from.

Mountain Clammer was an idea born as I said the word "climber" to myself over and over again. It eventually morphed into the word "clammer" and this game's idea came to be. 

The gameplay is similar to that of Getting Over It or Jump King, one long level you must ascend where all progress is temporary. The movement mechanic is very silly, and the game has been a lot of fun to make. Crunch time hit hard, so there were quite a few features I had to cut that I'll implement in a new version soon.

Here's the list of planned features:

dynamic/adaptive music

dynamic/adaptive sound effects

sound effects in cutscenes

volume sliders working

better background

more art in the levels, no more bare-bones geometry

more particle effects

victory visual and sound effect

custom pixel art font

clam always faces tongue

better clam sprite and animations

a timed challenge mode

Enjoy the game!
